edu.cmu.sei.arche
Class ArchEUIPlugin

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.core.runtime.Plugin
      org.eclipse.ui.plugin.AbstractUIPlugin
          edu.cmu.sei.arche.ArchEUIPlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator, java.util.EventListener, org.eclipse.jface.util.IPropertyChangeListener, IRefreshableUI, org.eclipse.core.resources.IResourceChangeListener, org.eclipse.ui.IWindowListener
public class ArchEUIPlugin
extends org.eclipse.ui.plugin.AbstractUIPlugin
implements IRefreshableUI, org.eclipse.core.resources.IResourceChangeListener, org.eclipse.jface.util.IPropertyChangeListener, org.eclipse.ui.IWindowListener

The main plugin class for SEI.ArchE.UI. Every Eclipse plugin that interacts with the platform UI has to define a class like this. It provides access to various services, such as a registry of images, persistent user preferences, current open project, resource bundles etc.

In particular, this plugin class is responsible for managing the life cycle of ArchE projects, with respect to the peculiarity that ArchE allows only one project to be open at a time.

Author:
Paulo Merson
See Also:
AbstractUIPlugin

propertyChange

public void propertyChange(org.eclipse.jface.util.PropertyChangeEvent event)
A property in the ArchE user preferences has changed. Here we pay heed to the property that defines the RFs that are active. If an RF was activated/deactivated, we updated that information in ProjectVO of the currently opened project and then refresh the views. Note that we make the RF id the id of the preference property itself.

Specified by:
propertyChange in interface org.eclipse.jface.util.IPropertyChangeListener
See Also:
IPropertyChangeListener.propertyChange(org.eclipse.jface.util.PropertyChangeEvent)

getOpenProject

public org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject getOpenProject()
Eclipse by default allows several projects to be open at the same time. In ArchE that can cause problems. Therefore, as an invariant, ONLY ONE PROJECT CAN BE OPEN AT THE SAME TIME. This method returns the one project that is open now.

Returns:
project that is open or null if there's no open project at the moment.

getProjectVo

public ProjectVO getProjectVo()
There's at most one open project. This method returns the ProjectVO object associated with that project.

Returns:
ProjectVO object of the currently open project or null if there's no open project or a problem occured.

getArchEFacade

public ArchEFacade getArchEFacade()
There's at most one open project. This method returns the ArchEFacade object associated with that project.

Returns:
ArchEFacade object of the currently open project or null if there's no open project or a problem occured.

Specified by:

Parameters:
clazz - VO class that changed and is requiring the views to be flagged for refresh.
See Also:
IRefreshableUI.flagViewsToRefresh(java.lang.Class)

refreshViews

public void refreshViews()
For each view, check if it needs refresh and if so call refresh on it. This method may be called in a parallel thread (not the UI thread). Therefore, we refresh views calling Display.syncExec(), which will permit the refresh calls to be executed by the UI thread whenever possible, while this method is blocked waiting until the UI thread does it.

Specified by:
refreshViews in interface IRefreshableUI
See Also:
IRefreshableUI.refreshViews()

getAvailableRFs

public java.util.Hashtable getAvailableRFs()
Returns:
Returns the Hashtable (ReasoningFrameworkVO --> Boolean) with all RFs loaded from all RF plugins found, The Boolean value is true if that RF is active (user preference).

shutdownProject

                     throws org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException,
                            ArchEException
Calls facade to shutdown project (i.e. shutdown core for this project). Method is public because it's used in JUnit PDE tests.

Parameters:
project -
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException - Eclipse couldn't find the facade property
ArchEException - Trying to shutdown a project that was not open

resourceChanged

public void resourceChanged(org.eclipse.core.resources.IResourceChangeEvent event)
We want to know when a project is opened or closed so that we can refresh the views accordingly. When a project is created, it's openned as well. So, all we need to track is when projects are opened/closed:
  • If a project is opened, the previously opened project has to be closed. We need to initialize the project data (facade, ProjectVO, active RFs). Views are asked to refresh so that they can get data from the newly opened project.
  • If a project is closed, we have to refresh views so that they do not show data from the previous project. Also, we have to release resources such as ProjectVO and shutdown the facade.
NB: The event does not indicate what project is being openned (event.getResource() is null for some unknown reason), so we have to look for the open project in the workspace.

NB2: We have to listen to POST_AUTO_BUILD because during a POST_CHANGE the workspace is locked for change. Although we don't perform any "project build" in ArchE projects, the event still fires. By the way, the POST_AUTO_BUILD event fires even if "Perform build automatically on resource modification" is unchecked on the Workbench preferences. (Thank God!) NB3: We have to listen to PRE_CLOSE to identify close project operations before they are concluded. In this cases, we cannot refresh views, but we can shutdown the facade.

Specified by:
resourceChanged in interface org.eclipse.core.resources.IResourceChangeListener
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException
See Also:
IResourceChangeListener.resourceChanged(org.eclipse.core.resources.IResourceChangeEvent)

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException

getQuestionParser

Returns the questionParser.

getAvailableDFs

public java.util.Hashtable getAvailableDFs()
Returns:
Returns the availableDFs, a Hashtable that maps DesignFilterVO objects to Boolean objects. It shall contain as keys all DesignFilterVOs that the DesignReader found as available from the designconfig.xml file. The Boolean value is set to true. It is however dertermined by the user preferences set for the eclipse workbench and is true if that design filter is active for and false otherwise.
